mapper.insert: insert into jy_pos_price_apply ( id, orderno, createuser, orgid, creorgid, createtime, rejectcause, status, note ) values ( #{id, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{orderNo, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{createUser, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{orgId, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{creOrgId, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, sysdate, #{rejectCause, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{status, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, #{note, jdbcType=VARCHAR} )
mapper.select:
select i.*, (select a.name from JY_BASE_ACCOUNT a where a.id = i.createuser) as createName, (select a.name from JY_BASE_ACCOUNT a where a.id = i.checkuser) as checkName, (select o.name from JY_BASE_ORG o where i.creorgid = o.id) as orgName, (select o.name from JY_BASE_ORG o where i.checkorg = o.id) as checkOrgName from jy_pos_price_apply i where 1 = 1
and i.id = #{id}
mapper.update: update jy_pos_price_apply set orgid = #{orgId, jdbcType = VARCHAR}, status = #{status, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, rejectcause = #{rejectCause, jdbcType=VARCHAR}, note = #{note, jdbcType=VARCHAR} where id = #{id, jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.delete: delete from jy_pos_price_apply where id = #{id, jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: SELECT jbg.id,jbg.name,jbg.pid as pId,jbg.orggrade as orgGrade FROM jy_base_org jbg start with jbg.id= #{id} connect by prior jbg.id = jbg.pid and jbg.status='1' and jbg.orggrade != '1' ORDER BY jbg.orggrade desc,jbg.sort
